lines.gurmukhi: siqgur crn srin cil jwey isK qw crn srin jgqu cil AwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Charan Sarani Chali Jaaay Sikha , Taa Charan Sarani Jagatu Chali Aavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh who devotedly goes to the refuge of a True Guru, has the whole world falling at his feet.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur AwigAw siq siq kir mwnY isK AwigAw qwih skl sMswrih ihqwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Aagiaa Sati Sati Kari Maanai Sikha , Aagiaa Taahi Sakal Sansaarahi Hitaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh of the Guru who abides by the command of his Guru, accepting it to be true; his command is loved by the whole world.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur syvw Bwie pRwn pUjw krY isK srb inDwn AgRBwig ilv lwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Sayvaa Bhaai Praan Poojaa Karai Sikha , Sarab Nidhaan Agrabhaagi Liv Laavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh of the Guru who serves his Guru with loving devotion at the cost of his life considering such service as worship, all the treasures are mute attendant before him.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur sIiKAw dIiKAw ihrdy p√çys jwih qw kI sIK sunq prmpd pwveI ]87]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Seekhiaa Deekhiaa Hiraday Pravays Jaahi , Taa Kee Seekh Sounat Paramapad Paavaee ?87?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh of the Guru who has the teachings and consecration of his Guru in his heart, listening to his teachings/sermons one can reach supreme spiritual state. (87)
